title: David's Plea for Justice
shortSummary: Psalm 35 is a heartfelt prayer of David calling on the Lord to defend him against his enemies who unjustly persecute him. The psalm expresses deep trust in God's salvation and justice, while also highlighting David's innocence and his commitment to righteousness despite suffering. It encourages believers to seek God's help in times of trouble and to praise Him for His deliverance.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the psalm, a king of Israel who appeals to God for protection and vindication against his adversaries.

keyCharacters.name: False Witnesses
keyCharacters.description: Individuals who rise against David, accusing him falsely and causing him harm without cause.

keyCharacters.name: The Angel of the LORD
keyCharacters.description: A divine agent who is called upon to pursue and bring judgment upon David's enemies.

A coarse garment worn during mourning or repentance, indicating humility and sorrow.
Those who feign friendship or innocence but secretly deride and oppose the psalmist.

outline.heading: David’s Plea for Divine Protection
outline.description: David implores the Lord to contend with his adversaries and to act as his shield and defender, calling for their confusion and defeat as they plot against him without cause.

outline.heading: David’s Expression of Trust and Innocence
outline.description: Despite his enemies’ false accusations and ill-treatment, David rejoices in the Lord’s salvation and recounts his own compassionate behavior toward those who opposed him.

outline.heading: The Enemies’ Malice and David’s Cry for Justice
outline.description: David describes the malicious joy of his enemies and their deceitful schemes, pleading with God to intervene and rescue him from their attacks.

outline.heading: David’s Prayer for Vindication and Praise
outline.description: David calls on God to judge righteously and not allow his enemies to triumph, promising to continually praise the Lord for His justice and favor.

application: Trust God to be your defender when facing unjust opposition, knowing He is your shield and salvation.
Respond to mistreatment with humility and compassion, following David’s example of praying and fasting rather than retaliation.
Persist in prayer for God’s justice, asking Him to vindicate your cause and to bring shame on those who act deceitfully.
Praise God continually for His righteousness and deliverance, encouraging others to recognize His power and faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: Plead my cause, O LORD, with them that strive with me: fight against them that fight against me.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone of the psalm as a direct appeal for God's active intervention on behalf of the righteous.

keyVerses.text: And my soul shall be joyful in the LORD: it shall rejoice in his salvation.
keyVerses.significance: David expresses his confident joy in God’s salvation despite his troubles, modeling faith and hope for believers.

keyVerses.text: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth: I humbled my soul with fasting; and my prayer returned into mine own bosom.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals David’s compassionate character and his humble response to adversity through prayer and fasting.

keyVerses.text: Let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous cause: yea, let them say continually, Let the LORD be magnified, which hath pleasure in the prosperity of his servant.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the ultimate goal of vindication: the magnification of the Lord who delights in the well-being of His faithful servants.
